title: From Speech to Summary: A Comprehensive Survey of Speech Summarization
author: Fabian Retkowski (KIT), Maike Züfle (KIT), Andreas Sudmann (University Bonn), Dinah Pfau (Deutsches Museum), Jan Niehues (KIT), Alexander Waibel (CMU), ...
relevance_why: This survey provides an extensive overview of speech summarization techniques, datasets, and challenges, which can inform and enhance methodologies in audio-language processing.
background: This paper reviews existing approaches for condensing spoken content into shorter summaries while preserving key information.
contribution: The survey introduces a comprehensive synthesis of speech summarization (SSum) research, covering datasets and methodologies while highlighting advancements from traditional systems to state-of-the-art models.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous works focused on specific aspects of speech summarization or were narrowly scoped within speech recognition or text summarization fields.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides an integrated perspective that encompasses various interrelated domains and clarifies the unique challenges of speech summarization.

key_innovation: It consolidates fragmented research areas in speech summarization, offering insights into challenges and opportunities for future advancements.
real_world_impact: Helps to facilitate advancements in transforming audio content into summarized formats, enhancing user accessibility and information retrieval in daily communications.
limitations: No immediate impact mentioned; still evolving with the integration of new models and approaches.
